title: 114_hr5770
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016" establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. The plan covers veterans enrolled in the patient enrollment system and survivors or dependents eligible for medical care. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the plan, providing benefits for dental care and treatment. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the dental insurance plan, providing benefits for dental care such as diagnostic, preventative, restorative, surgical, and emergency services. Enrollment in the plan is voluntary for a minimum period set by the Secretary, with premiums adjusted annually to cover all costs. The Secretary adjusts dental insurance plan premiums annually and notifies individuals of changes. Enrollees must pay the full premium and copayments. Voluntary disenrollment is allowed within 30 days of enrollment or under specific circumstances that do not harm the plan's financial stability. The Secretary allows voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan under specific circumstances, such as relocation, serious medical conditions, and other situations determined by the Secretary. Procedures are in place for timely determinations on disenrollments. The dental insurance plan allows voluntary disenrollment under certain conditions, with procedures for timely determinations. The Secretary's responsibility to provide dental care is unaffected, and regulations will govern the plan's administration. The section terminates on December 31, 2021. Repeal of dental insurance plan for veterans and dependents under the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010. Section 510 is repealed, and the table of contents is amended accordingly.
